Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Jar stand
Description: Asymmetrical jar stand with a triangular lip at the base and a flared opening with a simple lip at the top. The clay is common and orange (Nile clay) and has been carefully polished as well as covered with a light red ochre wash.
